columns.text: In this problem, we are required to determine the earnings per share, dividends per share, book value per share, market-to-book ratio, price-earnings ratio, and price-sales ratio for Makers Corp.

## a. Earnings per share 

Earnings per share or EPS is financial ratio in which a portion of the company's profit is allocated to each outstanding share of common stock.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{EPS}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Net income - Preferred Dividends}} {\text{Average outstanding 
 common shares}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

To determine the earnings per share or EPS:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{EPS}& =
 \dfrac{\text{(Additions to Retained Earning + Dividends paid)}} {\text{Average outstanding 
 common shares}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$415,000 + \$220,000} {170,000}\\ \\
&= \boxed{\$3.74}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
In conclusion, the earnings per share is **$3.74**.

## b. Dividends per share

Dividends per share or DPS is the amount of dividends issued by a company attributed for every ordinary share outstanding.

The formula is denoted as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{DPS}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Total dividends paid}} {\text{Number of 
 Common shares}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

To determine the dividends per share or DPS:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{DPS}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Total dividends paid}} {\text{Number of 
 Common shares}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$220,000} {170,000}\\ \\
&= \boxed{\$1.29}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
In conclusion, the dividend per share is **$1.29**.

## c. Book value per share

Book value per share or BVPS is a ratio of equity available to common shareholders.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{BVPS}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Total Equity}} {\text{Number of 
 Common shares}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

To determine the book value per share or BVPS:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{BVPS}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Total Equity}} {\text{Number of 
 Common shares}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$5,600,000} {170,000}\\ \\
&= \boxed{\$32.94}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
In conclusion, the book value per share is **$32.94**.

## d. Market-to-book ratio

Market-to-book ratio or MTBR compares the company's market value to its book value.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{MTBR}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Price per share}} {\text{Book value per share}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

To determine the market-to-book ratio or MTBR:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{MTBR}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Price per share}} {\text{Book value per share}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$65.00} {\$32.94}\\ \\
&= \boxed{1.97}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
In conclusion, the market-to-book is **1.97**.

## e. Price–earnings ratio

Price–earnings ratio measures the company's current share price relative to its earnings per share.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Price–earnings ratio}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Share Price}} {\text{Earnings per share}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

To determine the price–earnings ratio:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Price–earnings ratio}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Share Price}} {\text{Earnings per share}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$65.00} {\$3.74}\\ \\
&= \boxed{17.38}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
In conclusion, the price–earnings ratio is 17.38.

## f. Price–sales ratio

Price–sales ratio measures the company's current share price relative to its total sales.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Price–sales ratio}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Share Price}} {\text{Sales per share}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

Before we determine the price–sales ratio, let us first determine the sales per share:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sales per share}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Total sales}} {\text{Number of common shares}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$7,450,000} {170,000}\\ \\
&= \boxed{\$43.82}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Now that we have determined the sales per share, we can already determine the price-sales ratio:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Price–sales ratio}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Share Price}} {\text{Sales per share}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$65.00} {\$43.82}\\ \\
&= \boxed{1.48}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
In conclusion, the price-sales ratio is **1.48**.
